alert.note: Alert for Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:24PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Geneva and northwestern Houston Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 624 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Taylor, or 7 miles west of Dothan, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dothan, Hartford, Taylor, Slocomb, Malvern, Hollis Dairy Road, Fadette, Green Acres, Dundee, Bald Hill, Hendrix Crossroad, Bailey Crossroad, Light, W. Main/brannon St, Jones Crossroads and Wicksburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
